actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Census and Population.
Mr. Kanjorski asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Committee on Post Office and Civil Service discharged.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

official_title: Designating the month of May as "Asian/Pacific American Heritage Month".

summary.text: Amends Federal law to authorize the President to designate May 1990 as Asian/Pacific American Heritage Month. (Current law designates a seven-day period beginning on May 4, 1979).

titles.title: Designating the month of May as "Asian/Pacific American Heritage Month".
